alert.note: Alert for Denali (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 10:34AM AKST until February 22 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy Snow occurring with periods of low visibility. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, are expected through this afternoon. This will give a storm total accumulation of 14 inches since Monday south of McKinley Village. North of McKinley Village, storm totals will be 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...South of McKinley Village * WHEN...Until 6 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will continue through this afternoon, then taper off in the late afternoon. North of the Denali Park entrance, south winds gusting 40 mph area causing blowing snow, but those winds and blowing snow will taper off late this morning. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe winter weather conditions are occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
